DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric visual representation of the logical arrangement of a general class describing the level of disease of any human biologic material sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Category; used informally to mean a class of things._Display; exhibiting openly in public view; a visual representation of something._A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Property.preferredDefinition: Exhibit, present, or demonstrate for viewing.:A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

Concepts.definition: Exhibit, present, or demonstrate for viewing.
A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements; a condition of regular or proper arrangement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by S.Lalkota. mc 8/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Category; used informally to mean a class of things._Display; exhibiting openly in public view; a visual representation of something._A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.:Display; exhibiting openly in public view; a visual representation of something.:A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
Exhibit, present, or demonstrate for viewing.
A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements; a condition of regular or proper arrangement.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
